landing.accept_terms: By clicking the button, you agree to our
landing.browser_not_support: I apologize for any inconvenience. Please try using a more updated browser for better compatibility.
landing.slogan: A Simple, Lightweight, Cross-Platform Personal Note-Taking Application
landing.feature_simple_desc: Very simple to use, skip the complicated settings
landing.feature_multi_platform_desc: Use on all electronic devices you have, from phones to computers
landing.feature_sync_desc: Sync anytime, anywhere, as long as you have Internet. Supports offline use
landing.feature_e2e_desc: Encrypt note data with the AES algorithm before storing on the server
landing.signature_easy_desc: OpenNotas is designed to be easy to use. Just a tap and you can start writing notes immediately.
landing.signature_multi_platform_desc: OpenNotas is available on most platforms, from mobile to desktop, from Windows to Linux, MacOS.
landing.signature_sync_desc: You can set up note syncing across devices through Adapter configuration.
landing.signature_e2e_desc: Note data is encrypted with the AES algorithm before reaching the sync server, keeping your data always safe and secure.
landing.faqs_answer_1: Yes, OpenNotas is completely free and open source.
landing.faqs_question_2: Can I use OpenNotas without an Internet connection?
landing.faqs_answer_2: Yes, you can use OpenNotas without an Internet connection. Data will be stored on your device and sync when you have an Internet connection.
landing.faqs_question_3: Does OpenNotas store my note data?
landing.faqs_answer_3: No, your note data is encrypted with the AES algorithm before it reaches the sync server. We do not store your note data.
landing.faqs_question_4: I want to access my notes on a different device
landing.faqs_answer_4: Use the sync feature. Note data is encrypted with the AES algorithm before being stored on the sync server. You will also need to remember the secret key if you want to read your notes.
landing.faqs_question_5: Will my data ever be lost?
landing.faqs_answer_5: Data is stored in the persistent memory of the browser you use to install OpenNotas. Therefore, data is only lost when you clear the cache or uninstall the OpenNotas app or the browser. I recommend you use the sync feature or back up your data regularly to avoid unfortunate situations.
landing.faqs_question_6: I'm experiencing some errors, what should I do?
landing.faqs_answer_6: Contact me directly or via the Telegram community channel for assistance!
landing.start_using_slogan: Install the best personal note-taking app, fast, secure, and free

app.slogan: A Simple, Lightweight, Cross-Platform Personal Note-Taking Application
app.modal_alert_set_password_content: You need to set a note password in "Settings" > "General" before locking the note
app.modal_confirm_change_adapter_content: Changing the sync adapter will erase all current data and sync new data. If the data has never been synced, select "Cancel" then go to "Settings" > "Tools" > "Export Notes" to backup. Are you sure you want to change?
app.modal_confirm_delete_folder_content: Deleting the folder will permanently delete the folder, and notes inside will be moved to the trash. Are you sure?
app.modal_confirm_e2ee_key_content: Before synchronizing data, you need to re-enter the previously backed up encryption key. If you've never synchronized before, click on "Generate Key" to get a new key.
app.modal_import_notes_content: Import data exported from OpenNotas, old data is not affected, new data is added
app.message_note_copied_clipboard_lock_error: It is not possible to copy a locked note
app.message_note_can_not_save: Cannot save notes, try switching to another editor like CodeMirror
